description: President-elect Donald Trump said he will nominate former Congressman Sean Duffy as the head of his Department of Transportation.
title: Trump Picks Sean Duffy for Transportation Secretary

description: Donald Trump is planning to attend the launch of Elon Musk’s Starship rocket in Texas on Tuesday, according to people familiar with the matter, a nod to the billionaire entrepreneur’s growing role in the president-elect’s political sphere.
title: Trump to Attend Elon Musk’s Starship Rocket Launch in Texas

description: Joe Biden’s decision to let Ukraine hit targets inside Russia failed to galvanize broader allied support for Kyiv, in a sign of the outgoing president’s waning influence.
title: Biden’s Missile Call No Longer Enough to Rally Ukraine’s Allies

description: President Joe Biden pledged $4 billion for the World Bank unit focused on low-interest loans and grants to the poorest nations, bolstering the effort to secure funding amid uncertainty over the policies of President-elect Donald Trump.
title: US Pledges $4 Billion for World Bank Arm Focused on Poor Nations

description: Brendan Carr, the incoming chairman of the Federal Communications Commission, plans to challenge big technology and broadcast companies over their content choices and kill diversity and inclusion initiatives at the agency that oversees the nation’s telecom, internet and media industries.
title: New FCC Chair Is a Fan of Elon Musk, Not Diversity Initiatives

description: New York City’s transit system is moving forward with a plan to start charging motorists a fee to drive into crowded midtown Manhattan starting Jan. 5. The aim of the congestion pricing initiative, which will be the first in the US, is to reduce traffic and pollution while raising money for the city’s subways, buses and commuter rails.
title: Why New York Made a U-Turn on Congestion Pricing

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, congressional correspondent Steven T. Dennis looks at the budget and voting math for Trump’s agenda. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Faces Some Tough Math for His Agenda Next Year

description: The Manhattan prosecutor who won the only criminal conviction of Donald Trump faces a Tuesday deadline to say how he thinks the case should proceed in light of the former president’s reelection.
title: Trump DA Faces Key Deadline as New York Hush Money Case in Limbo

description: President-elect Donald Trump confirmed his intention to use the US military to carry out what he has vowed will be the largest mass deportation in US history.
title: Trump Confirms He Plans to Use Military for Mass Deportations

description: Under sunshine and clear blue skies against a picture-perfect backdrop of Rio’s iconic Sugarloaf Mountain, the Group of 20 leaders gathered for their “family photo.” There was just one snag: US President Joe Biden was missing.
title: Where Was Biden? The G-20 Photo Shows Him Out of The Picture

description: Hedge-fund titan Ken Griffin said he’s anxious about Donald Trump’s potential tariff policies, but that the US economy is going back to “the business of business” now that he’s returning to the White House.
title: Ken Griffin Says He’s ‘Very Anxious’ About Trump’s Tariff Policy

description: Venezuela’s government blamed “extremists” for an explosion at a natural gas plant in eastern Venezuela that has left most of Margarita Island in the dark for days.
title: Venezuela Government Blames ‘Extremists’ for Gas Plant Blast

description: The UK will have to balance any deal on tariffs offered by US President-elect Donald Trump with wider concerns on how it would affect trade ties with the European Union, Business and Trade Secretary Jonathan Reynolds said Monday.
title: UK’s Reynolds Warns Against Choosing US Over EU in Tariff Talks

description: Italy’s center-left won back the central Italian region of Umbria in local elections in a blow for Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni’s coalition.
title: Italy’s Left Wins Regional Elections in Upset for Premier Meloni

description: San Francisco Mayor-elect Daniel Lurie assembled a transition team that includes OpenAI co-founder Sam Altman, leveraging influential local leaders as the political newcomer takes the reins of the city’s bureaucracy.
title: Sam Altman Joins Transition Team for New San Francisco Mayor

description: The Metropolitan Transportation Authority approved a revised congestion pricing plan for Manhattan that President-elect Donald Trump has threatened to terminate once he takes office.
title: New York’s Transit Agency Approves $9 Congestion Pricing Toll

description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz defended his decision not to give Ukraine Taurus long-range missiles, even as the US has decided to authorize Kyiv to use its weapons to strike inside Russia.
title: Germany Won’t Give Ukraine Long-Range Missile Even After US Move

description: Moldova’s prime minister announced changes to his cabinet line-up after the nation’s pro-Western president pledged a reshuffle following a referendum on European Union membership.
title: Moldova Reshuffles Government After Tight EU Referendum

description: The outgoing Biden-Harris administration has levied more sanctions against extremist Israeli settlers in the occupied West Bank, actions that could be undone by President-elect Donald Trump and his nominees.
title: US Sanctions More Hardline Israeli Settlers Before Trump’s Term

description: Poland’s head of state said Chancellor Olaf Scholz is trying to cut Donald Trump out of talks over the future of Ukraine in a bid to revive Germany’s own relations with the Kremlin.
title: Poland’s Leader Says Scholz Is Undermining Trump Push to End War

description: Exchange-traded funds that buy Chinese stocks continue to see outflows amid rising concerns over the nation’s growth outlook and the risk of new tariffs under a Donald Trump administration.
title: China ETFs Bleed Cash as Traders Flee on Stimulus, Trump Tariffs

description: With RFK Jr., Trump rebrands himself yet again—even if transforming the “industrial food complex” is much more complicated than he’d admit.
title: Democrats Let MAGA Co-Opt the Healthy Food Movement

description: President-elect Donald Trump is slated to soon name a close JD Vance ally, James Braid, to serve as the White House Director of Legislative Affairs, according to people familiar with the process.
title: Trump Set to Pick Vance Ally James Braid as Congress Liaison

description: Two Democratic congressmen from New York City said their party needs to move away from “identity politics” and focus on helping working-class people achieve financial success.
title: NYC Democratic Congressmen Blast Party for ‘Identity Politics’

description: The House Ethics Committee plans to meet behind closed doors Wednesday as it faces demands to release its findings on sexual misconduct allegations against former Representative Matt Gaetz, President-elect Donald Trump’s nominee to be US Attorney General, according to people familiar with the plan.
title: House Ethics Panel to Meet Amid Pressure to Reveal Matt Gaetz Findings

description: Some of President-elect Donald Trump’s key advisers are signaling support for Kevin Warsh, a former Federal Reserve governor, to be the next Treasury secretary, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Trump Team Shows Support for Warsh as Treasury Feuding Persists

description: US Representative Mikie Sherrill of New Jersey joined the crowded race to succeed Governor Phil Murphy, saying her leadership experience as a US Navy helicopter commander will help her boost the state’s economy and build more housing.
title: Mikie Sherrill Joins Democrats in Crowded Race for NJ Governor

description: Ukraine said at least 21 people were killed in missile attacks following a massive barrage on its energy infrastructure as Group of 20 leaders discuss how the war will end at a meeting in Brazil.
title: Ukraine Says 21 Killed by Russian Missiles Ahead of G-20 Summit

description: China’s growing assistance to Russia for its war in Ukraine “will and must have consequences,” German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock warned as top European Union diplomats met in Brussels Monday.
title: EU Discusses Consequences for China Over Drone Aid to Russia

description: The European Council agreed to provide the Rwanda Defence Force with an additional €20 million to support its deployment in Mozambique, where it’s helping to fight an Islamic State-backed insurgency.
title: EU Gives Rwanda Extra €20 Million to Fight Terror in Mozambique

description: At a black-tie gala at Mar-a-Lago the other night, Argentine President Javier Milei couldn’t contain himself. The gathering had been arranged to celebrate the election of his guy Donald Trump, and no one was going to outdo Milei. He whirled, pivoted, swayed, bro-hugged, flashed the thumbs-up sign — sometimes one, sometimes, for emphasis, two — and beamed the broadest of smiles as the cameras flashed.
title: Javier Milei Is Giddy About Trump and His Own Accomplishments

description: Sri Lanka’s President Anura Kumara Dissanayake retained the finance and defense portfolios as he administered the oath of office to 21 cabinet ministers on Monday after his coalition won a historic supermajority in the parliamentary election held last week.
title: Sri Lankan President Keeps Finance Minister’s Job in New Cabinet

description: Moody’s Ratings downgraded Bangladesh’s sovereign rating on Monday, citing heightened political risks and lower growth prospects for the South Asian nation.
title: Moody’s Cuts Bangladesh Further Into Junk on Political Risks

description: Austria’s centrist parties are entering formal negotiations on a three-way government coalition with the aim of broad-ranging policy change and sidelining the far-right Freedom Party.
title: Austria Seeks Three-Way Coalition to Quash Far-Right’s Rise

description: Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis warned of the damage a trade war with the US would cause the European Union and said an accord is possible with the incoming Donald Trump administration.
title: Greek Premier Urges EU to Seek Trade Deal With Trump

description: Germany’s opposition conservatives maintained a strong lead in opinion polls ahead of the Feb. 23 election, though backing for the CDU/CSU alliance slipped slightly compared with the previous week.
title: German Conservatives Maintain Lead in Election Polling Average
Updates From G-20 Summit in Rio de Janeiro

description: Australia’s National Reconstruction Fund will invest A$40 million ($26 million) to boost mining equipment manufacturing in the state of Queensland, the billion-dollar vehicle’s first investment since being set up by the Labor government in 2023.
title: Australia’s National Investment Fund Makes First Bet on Mining

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Ukraine’s War-Weary Allies May Embolden Vladimir Putin

description: Greece plans to accelerate the repayment of billions of euros of bailout loans in the latest sign of the country’s economic reversal since it nearly fell out of the euro area more than a decade ago.
title: Greece to Repay €5 Billion of Long-Term Debt Early, Premier Says

description: He’s attempting to pull off plutocratic populism, but the math doesn’t square.
title: Trump’s Impossible Task: Delivering for the Working Class and Billionaires

description: US President Joe Biden’s top budget director is calling on Congress to swiftly pass disaster relief funds after several southern states were hit by back-to-back hurricanes causing billions in damage.
title: Biden Budget Chief Urges Congress to Pass Disaster Relief Funds

description: France’s powerful farming unions are taking to the streets again to seek more government support and rally against a European Union free trade deal with Latin American producers seen allowing in cheaper goods.
title: French Farmers Mobilize to Block EU’s Mercosur Trade Deal

description: Finland is stepping up preparedness with a new website aimed at ensuring citizens are ready in case of a crisis or conflict.
title: Finland Unveils Preparedness Website for Citizens in Case of Crisis

description: Greece’s navy extended for a sixth time a series of naval drills, prolonging them by another four months as the country tries to deter Russian oil transfers off its coastline.
title: Greece Extends Drills Hampering Transfer of Russian Oil Cargoes

description: Senegalese President Bassirou Diomaye Faye looks set to secure a parliamentary majority that will enable him to implement reforms needed to stabilize the state’s finances.
title: Senegal’s Faye Heads for Parliamentary Majority in Test for Reform Agenda

description: Elon Musk, listen to this episode.
title: How Fraudsters Are Bilking the Government Out of Billions of Dollars

description: After his victory, Donald Trump announced that Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy would be leading a new Department of Government Efficiency in order to crack down on wasteful, fraudulent spending inside the federal government. Setting aside the question of how effective this particular endeavor will be, the basic premise of cracking down on waste and going after fraudsters should generally be non-controversial. So what does fraud look like? How do companies bilk programs like Medicare and Medicaid f
title: Odd Lots: How Fraud Costs the Government Billions (Podcast)

description: Reuben Brigety, the US ambassador to South Africa, said he will resign effective Jan. 10 in line with procedure after Donald Trump election victory.
title: US Ambassador to South Africa Brigety Says He Will Resign

description: European Central Bank Governing Council member Joachim Nagel sees the threat of a further fragmentation of the global economy, which could present central banks with new challenges in the form of higher or more volatile inflation.
title: ECB’s Nagel Warns Economic Fragmentation Risk Is Escalating

description: Mauritius’s new premier ordered an audit of Finance Ministry data that he said shows the economy is doing better than it actually is.
title: Mauritian Prime Minister Orders Review of ‘Wrong’ Treasury Data

description: Olaf Scholz received some support from the ranks of his Social Democrats after several party officials questioned whether he should be the top candidate in Germany’s upcoming snap election given his poor popularity ratings.
title: Scholz’s Party Allies Start Fight Back Against Internal Critics

description: Indian city gas distributors’ stocks tumbled Monday after the government cut allocations of natural gas for a second month, triggering analyst downgrades.
title: Indian Gas Retailers’ Shares Sink as Supply Cut Hits Margins

description: France’s budget is advancing through fractious parliamentary debates toward a precipice in December when far-right leader Marine Le Pen can let the bill become law, or trigger chaos by toppling the government in a no-confidence vote.
title: French Budget Heads Toward Game of Chicken With Le Pen

description: The US and the Philippines on Monday signed a deal on military information sharing, bolstering ties two months before Donald Trump assumes the presidency.
title: US, Philippines Sign New Military Deal Before Trump’s Return

description: US Ambassador to Australia Caroline Kennedy described her cousin Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s views on vaccinations as “dangerous,” the latest public rebuke by a senior member of the storied family against the man Donald Trump has tapped for a key Cabinet post.
title: Caroline Kennedy Calls Cousin RFK Jr.’s Vaccine Views Dangerous

description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un vowed to bolster the nation’s nuclear capabilities “without limit” to counter the threats posed by the security partnership between the US and its allies in the region, North Korean state media reported Monday.
title: Kim Jong Un Vows to Boost Nuclear Capabilities ‘Without Limit’

description: Australia’s plan to cap international student numbers looks set to be blocked after opposition politicians decided to vote against the proposed laws, even after they had repeatedly urged cuts to migration.
title: Australia’s International Student Caps Likely to Be Blocked

description: Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda avoided giving a clear hint that he will raise interest rates at a December meeting during closely watched comments that weakened the yen.
title: Ueda’s Caution Over Hinting at BOJ Rate Hike Timing Weakens Yen

description: President-elect Donald Trump has chosen Brendan Carr, the senior Republican on the Federal Communications Commission, as its chair, he said in a statement.
title: Trump Designates FCC Veteran Brendan Carr as Chair of Agency
